content: Investments ETF DBS Vickers Securities Asked by AnonymousAsked on 22 May 2019Hi, need advice on S&P 500 ETF. I use DBS vickers. Which ETF to pick? Does DBS Vickers allow me to buy Irish-domiciled ETFs? US-domiciled ETFs are subject to 30% tax? which ETF would you pick?1 answerAnswerBump0
Answers (1)Sort By Most UpvoteMost UpvoteMost Recent

Gabriel Tham, Kenichi Tag Team Member at Tag TeamLevel 8. WizardAnswered on 12 Jun 2019Yes all US stocks are all subjected to 30% dividend withholding taxes.Vickers has access to UK markets and thus you can access irish domiciled ETFs if they are listed there.ishares, vanguard and spdr S&P500 ETF are the more common ones from the big names.0 comments0
